title: @Roit Shyvana Still Needs Work
body:
She is so much weaker before these nerfs. Yasou can use his Q and knock me up mid ult so that buff isnt working correctly. When a select few CC can stop the Ult the changes make her much weaker. We the massive gutting of fevor she is setting really poorly. That ult change people where asking for to make it CC immune didn't really change her very much. Now she can ult in take 1 extra shot and die. Her new "E" you can just walk out and no big deal. The "W" change i would have never notice if it wasn't in the patch notes. So you nerfed her passive add extra counter play to her "E" and made knockups work when she ults in so that change wasn't very good and the extra health is nice but the passive hurts her already weak early game even more.

Did {{champion:82}}  teach you a lesson. Passive around map control suck and are a terrible waste of power budget. They can be counter with zero interaction with the player which leads to a very frustrating situation for the player and hinder game health.  

So all in all. You changed fevor so much it is worthless to AS champions. You nerfed every AS item because of fevor and only buffed 2 very slightly. Rageblade needed the buff before the fevor change and should have happen a few patches ago. She is weak because of items and mastery changes and few select buffs with heavy handed nerfs isn't going to fix a itemization problem she is having with every other AS champions. 

Rant over

replies.body: Certainly possible she still needs further work in the short term. Let's talk start of next week once the patch has settled a bit? Our estimate is that the 6.23 changes should have added noticeable power to her. If she's been left in an inappropriate spot though (even weaker, not buffed enough or overbuffed) we'd want to do some follow up changes as soon as feasible to correct that though.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PuHa88eE,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-11-23T19:56:00.990+0000)
>
> Certainly possible she still needs further work in the short term. Let's talk start of next week once the patch has settled a bit? Our estimate is that the 6.23 changes should have added noticeable power to her. If she's been left in an inappropriate spot though (even weaker, not buffed enough or overbuffed) we'd want to do some follow up changes as soon as feasible to correct that though.

Anyone can clearly see that gutting her Passive (yes, this is what you did - you ruined it by making it stupid, weak and extremely gimmicky - don't think otherwise) did not "add noticeable power to her".

It nullified any and all other buffs you gave her.

"gutting her passiv"? Are you sure about that? She only needs 3 drakes total to get to her old passiv, and the "double in dragon form" is compensated by the hp from her ult, since hp is always better the flat mr/ar if you already build/have some mr/ar. 
Only if you dont get any drakes and play her assasinstyle, w/o any ar/mr items then you might be nerfed a little in tankyness. 
Oh and she can get stacks from elder too.

Any chances she finaly looses the stupid 20% bonus vs monsters on W and gets something that might help her lane a bit in return?
Toplane shyvana has been dead for a long time now, and i really hoped that the opportunity thhat this small rework grants gets used, but so far it's been a nerf to her lane rather than any improvement.

Maybe it's just me, but i really don't like her current 'walking bag of gold' design where she's balanced around haveing a gold+xp advantage by default due to absurd clearspead. It leaves her kit underwhelming whenever she doesn't have that lead(includeing lategame). Reduceing her clear speed a tad(even without that 20% bonus vs monsters, she most likely will still have one of the fastest clears out there) and adding more power to her kit would be an imprtant move to make for her.
And while i like most of the recent changes, i certainly dislike the concept of a dragon based passive. It may be thematically compelling, but it's just inherently snowbally and unreliable while also causing issues on other maps.

> [{quoted}](name=Don Cingulum,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PuHa88eE,comment-id=00080007,timestamp=2016-11-24T02:32:08.052+0000)
>
> Any chances she finaly looses the stupid 20% bonus vs monsters on W and gets something that might help her lane a bit in return?
> Toplane shyvana has been dead for a long time now, and i really hoped that the opportunity thhat this small rework grants gets used, but so far it's been a nerf to her lane rather than any improvement.
> 
> Maybe it's just me, but i really don't like her current 'walking bag of gold' design where she's balanced around haveing a gold+xp advantage by default due to absurd clearspead. It leaves her kit underwhelming whenever she doesn't have that lead(includeing lategame). Reduceing her clear speed a tad(even without that 20% bonus vs monsters, she most likely will still have one of the fastest clears out there) and adding more power to her kit would be an imprtant move to make for her.
> And while i like most of the recent changes, i certainly dislike the concept of a dragon based passive. It may be thematically compelling, but it's just inherently snowbally and unreliable while also causing issues on other maps.

If we need to nerf her in the future, W's bonus damage to monsters is a mechanic that we'd like to remove as it would free us up to make more appreciable buffs for lane Shyvana.

> [{quoted}](name=Wav3Break,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PuHa88eE,comment-id=000800070000,timestamp=2016-11-24T18:24:15.749+0000)
>
> If we need to nerf her in the future, W's bonus damage to monsters is a mechanic that we'd like to remove as it would free us up to make more appreciable buffs for lane Shyvana.

Any changes for AP Shyv? The nerf on her e made it pretty hard to still be effective in lane.

To change the bag of gold attitude there is need for a much deeper rework, this is just some functionality change.

Put it this way - at least now she has a bit more of reasonable counterplay ( blocking her E  and being uninterruptible on her most important skill ) and has a reason to be picked beside being strong ( which is dragon control).

It' s not a gamechanger, but you can' t expect much from these kind of opportunistic changes.
I bet we'll have to wait for Rylais changes to hit live before you assess Mordekaiser too, yes?^^

Correct. We've tended to create more balance issues than we've addressed by trying to pre-emptively compensate for cases like this in the past. Plan is to make the Rylai's change and then see who does/doesn't need work as a result of it.
Speaking of rylais, any malz changes inc? since he is almost unplayable mid now, even with rylais being strong, without rylais he is basically Cassiopeia but worse... much worse.
The problem with Malz now is that his voidlings get instant-killed by AoE, which nullifies the champion completely.
yeah, annoying since the changes to his w were kinda unnecessary and poorly thought out, then again you could say the same for his whole rework.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PuHa88eE,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-11-23T19:56:00.990+0000)
>
> Certainly possible she still needs further work in the short term. Let's talk start of next week once the patch has settled a bit? Our estimate is that the 6.23 changes should have added noticeable power to her. If she's been left in an inappropriate spot though (even weaker, not buffed enough or overbuffed) we'd want to do some follow up changes as soon as feasible to correct that though.

Regardless of her power level, Shyvana is a bit unsatisfying when it comes to items and masteries.

1. She has no key mastery. Stormraider is decent, but in the wrong tree. Fervor is nerfed, but hopefully, that will no longer be true in the future. And the entire resolve tree, which is wanderful for shyvana, has no single key mastery that she would want to use in jungle. (Maybe if grasp worked on monsters?)

2. She is an attack speed juggernaut that wants CDR. This creates some problems, especially because she has to build squishy first (a good AS item), and then go tanky-ish or full-on tank. And AS item, coupled with titanic hydra (or trinity) and her natural resistances, was usually a good compromise between defense and offense. Now, however, she doesn't (reliably) have those resistances anymore.

3. Wit's End, which seems like the perfect item for Shyvana, is also too conditional. If only it offered health instead of MR...

Look no further : 

The Burnout (W) buff is not even noticeable in dragon form. Really, it is insignificant. 

The new dragon born passive is irrelevant. 

In human form, her flame breath (E) ability is terribly lacking.

twin bite (Q) is not quite worth levelling up. 

.... 

I mean, come on... 

Shyvana is a mess right now lol. I don't care what win rates and websites say. 
This champion just isn't competitive whatsoever, in its current state. 

Back in season 2 Shyvana used to have a very clear gameplay and a strong toolkit. She was built around counter-jungling, skirmishing and duelling. She was very tanky and did a lot of magic damage with her AoEs over time. Her item-build was also far more consistent : Lanter+Frozen mallet+Wit's end with mercurial boots. Everything made so much sense back then.
What would be something to do meditate her problems on other maps
We're looking at alternate scaling for other maps at present. Current thinking is Armor/MR per turret kill on ARAM and 10% damage against Vilemaw/Armor and MR from killing Vilemaw on TT.

IMO, this sounds awful for both of those maps and here is why:

- In ARAM if you're winning (and therefore taking towers) you'll get a stronger advantage making it harder for enemy team to counter you. If you're losing... you will get nothing and still lose.

- In TT Vilemaw is a very opportunistic objective, where you can only really take it after having a lead and taking other objectives since it's next to impossible to sneak a kill. This means if you are ahead you will get even further ahead, and if you are behind... you will get nothing and still lose.
Would armor/mr per turret kill or objective work on summoner's rift?  At the least, it would make her passive more consistent across all maps.
I don't even play Shyvana, and this sounds like a solid change. It'd be a good incentive to gank and push a lot of lanes

Giving her Ar/Mr from turret kills does not make much sense :S So on aram its justifed because there are no epics or so, only turrets. Making stuff always needs to fullfill 2 things: "is it balanced" and "does it make sense". It would be decently balanced, but doesnt make to much sense :/

I was hoping someone wouldn't point that out.
Yeah, you're 100% correct though. Perhaps we might see it on a future champ.

Could you guys maybe give a thought or two on other maps **before** doing changes?? 
Twisted Treeline's jungle has been hit alot once again with no one who seems to care.
The increased smite cd has a huge impact and causes alot junglers to be no longer viable, as they no longer have a second smite for their last camp.
And where has been no adjustments to compensate for the lack of smight buffs either, no longer haveing that damage return from smiting wolfs hurts the clearspeed of tanks quite a bit on TT.

>If she's been left in an inappropriate spot though (even weaker, not buffed enough or overbuffed) we'd want to do some follow up changes as soon as feasible to correct that though.

You'd better get working because I'm 90% sure that the changes were a net nerf to Shyvana.
I'm 90% confident they were a significant buff. Let's talk next week though!

the passive is weird since rarely you ever get more stats than older shyvanna especially in dragon form they used to double.

however it makes her a little healthier to play against i hate getting outdueled by the champion when i play a caster even tho she bought no defensive items.

yeah, but

1 you can take dragons easier
2 you have a bigger radius on W as dragon form, which is far more useful than a burnout
3 you have a more powerful E, that is able to refresh more than once the E buff making it last longer, compared to old shyv that would hit all enemies at once and then letting the buff expire because you had no mean or intrest to hit them all ( q cleave is not that much).
4 you have more size on dragon which means longer aa range, a ton of health and you have it uninterruptible
Early stats quite frankly show that you could even get away with tuning her back a bit, she is seeing a performance spike on a similar level as ivern from preseason.

Please for god sake make burning field from her dragon form E larger!!! its nice that it lasts for 4 seconds but literarily any1, unless hard CCed, can walk out with only 1 tick of dmg. Bcz Shyvana doesnÂ´t have any options how to keep them there for it to be relevant past first tick.

>Our estimate is that the 6.23 changes should have added noticeable power to her.

Yeah, but you guys also estimated that Taliyah needed a buff to minion damage. Then she was wiping waves at level 1 no sweat so you'll have to forgive us if we don't trust your estimates.
Thanks for listening.

I actually quite like the ability changes. I've yet to truly notice the range difference on the ult myself. Yes, I'm bronzie, but oh well I guess if that means you don't value my opinion.
 However, I don't like the passive as it is. I can understand wanting to change it, to make it feel more powerfully connected to her dragon heritage. But I think something went array with it. I don't like it being tied to an "optional" map objective. The change to extra health in dragon form also doesn't really ruffle my feathers either.  So even though I don't like her new passive, {{champion:102}} has not been over all nerfed. Passive is a nerf, rest are no more no less powerful, just different

She was nerfed with the last patch. She was one of the best user of fevor in the game. Able to stack it faster then almost any other champion. Now that they changed it from an AS champion to a ADC mastery she lost a lot of power. Meddler agreed and said they would do some changes to compensate. Her changes where to compensate for the per season changes and they missed that mark in my opinion. If you like her more power to you.

I've never used Fervor on my Shyvana for very good reasons.....
That mastery felt like a waste of time  on her, so I always went for Grasp or Thunderlord's. 
Those always felt better to me because attack speed Shyvana was garbage against people with brains. Sure you jump in and auto-attack a lot, that's great, what about your tankyness? How do you survive when you jump in? Her passive gave a little bit, but not enough to help you survive when focused on.
Auto - Q - Auto and you've already stacked 8 times. A waste of time? I think not.
Whatever buffs/quality of life changes they gave her were entirely nullified by them giving her the worst Passive in the game.

thats adorable op. she did not lose any power and from what i have seen of her so far she gained some power and new build paths due to the changes that she simply could not afford before, even better she can recover from behind so to you i say this.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

> [{quoted}](name=Karn Bishop,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PuHa88eE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-23T09:42:57.073+0000)
>
> thats adorable op. she did not lose any power and from what i have seen of her so far she gained some power and new build paths due to the changes that she simply could not afford before, even better she can recover from behind so to you i say this.
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

what are you talking about. Do you even play her. One of her biggest issue with the pre season changes is she lost the ability to catch up when behind. They changed the jungle spawn times which was her main way to catch up farming. She lost build paths when they nerfed very AS item. Now they where strong and need to be toned down. In season 5 she had a tank and damage paths. Now she has a single juggernaut build and that is about it.

More on this point: it wasn't just the changes to her kit, it was the destruction of everything she used. Jungle clears, fervor or strength, various bruiser item nerfs. The changes...well I'm still testing, but it doesn't feel like an improvement at all, which was the entire point of the rework. Riot got so caught up with "counterplay" that they forgot the entire reason they were trying to fix her in the first place: SHE WASNT COMPETITIVE with other junglers.

Any Shyv main will tell you all she needed was a better Ultimate Hitbox and Ignore CC during Dragon's Descent. Riot didn't need to fuck with the rest of her kit.

tbh if Riot were clever they'd play around with her Base/Scaling HP and HP Regen to bring lane Shyv back into the fold if they wanted to see more play out of her.

> [{quoted}](name=A Blue Quaker,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PuHa88eE,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-11-23T15:20:01.004+0000)
>
> Any Shyv main will tell you all she needed was a better Ultimate Hitbox and Ignore CC during Dragon's Descent. Riot didn't need to fuck with the rest of her kit.
> 
> tbh if Riot were clever they'd play around with her Base/Scaling HP and HP Regen to bring lane Shyv back into the fold if they wanted to see more play out of her.

Wasn't in patch notes, but I did re-script her ultimate to update more frequently and adjusted the hitbox to line up with her visuals a bit better.

> [{quoted}](name=Wav3Break,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PuHa88eE,comment-id=00060001,timestamp=2016-11-24T18:16:53.739+0000)
>
> Wasn't in patch notes, but I did re-script her ultimate to update more frequently and adjusted the hitbox to line up with her visuals a bit better.

According to OP she is still susceptible to disables (I.e. Yasuo) during her ult.

Was the change to her ult intended to be useless or was it just an accident?
I kinda like that there's a juggernaut in the jungle personally...
{{champion:2}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:106}}
Riot can't help themselves.

Every other shyvana game in a nutshell in 6.23 : 

- You decide to go top lane = you lose because shyvana is not a top laner =[ 

- The enemy team picks Vayne = You lose by default, because there is nothing you can do against health scaling true damage + infinite kitting. 

- The enemy team picks {{champion:64}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:254}}  = you lose by default because Shyvana can't do sh!t against those pesky champions (they also happen to be god tier though). 

- The enemy laners beat your team mates in laning phase before you can kill the first dragon = you are likely to lose the game right away. 

- The enemy team prevents you from farming dragons = you become useless.

- The enemy team walks away from you when you finally connect to them = you can't ever kill anything. 

- Eventhough you managed to reach lategame somehow, the enemy ADC builds {{item:3033}} = you become squishy as fuck. 

- Your team goes for a siege on objectives = you wander around aimlessly without purpose because there's nothing to do as Shyvana in this situation. 

LMAO

Seriously Rito -_- What did you expect ?

No shyvana is perfect, it's just me being a silver IV scrub that i'm too dumb in order to play her properly, i just need to relearn her, the fact that i shifted from 1v9 carrylord to I'MSORRYPLEASEDON'TKILLMEI'MNOTWORTHY in a night it's completely in my mind. It's not real. i just need to deal with it.

_Yours truly,
~~former~~ best shyvana EU_

I see what you did yeah. you are right. It is great the best she has ever been.

I love having "Skilled" champs like warwick and Rengar pick me off without being able to farm. I love being more or less kindred.

Hecarim and Lee are overpowered.

Riot's response; "Let's nerf Shyvana!"
English brother. That was awful.

It's Yasuo*, not Yasou
It bugs me, 3rd time I've seen it
